document.heading: District of Columbia Certificate of Need Act of 1980

history.narrative: Law 3-98, the “District of Columbia Certificate of Need Act of 1980,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 3-129, which was referred to the Committee on Public Services and Consumer Affairs. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 17, 1980, and July 1, 1980, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 16, 1980, it was assigned Act No. 3-220 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
